Don't start the quiz until after you've had a chance to review the syllabus and group project guidelines. You'll have 30 minutes to complete the quiz, but you can probably complete it much faster.

description: Submit a 1-page proposal. Define a problem for the organization of your choice that can be addressed by qualitative and survey research. Make sure the conclusion of the research will lead to actional insights. You will have a chance to revise this problem when you submit future plans.
name: Group Research - Define research question and company

description:
Define a problem that is optimally addressed by qualitative research. Develop a realistic plan that you will actually execute. Your plan should include:

  • Problem definition
  • Explanation why your qualitative technique is optimal to address this problem
  • Example of findings or results (e.g., quotes, figures, charts)
  • Logistics (execution dates, locations, compensation plan if any, plan for pretesting)
  • Appendix with research documents (e.g., screener, discussion guide, any other materials)

You can recruit participants a number of ways. Make sure to justify appropriateness of the sample both for research purposes and practicality.

  • Convenience sample - friends/classmates
  • Posters - around/off-campus
  • Social media advertisement
  • Customer observation (store, at home, online)
  • etc.
name: Group Research - Qualitative Research Plan

ratings.long_description: Clearly defines a specific problem, expertly outlining its relevance and scope for qualitative research
Adequately defines a problem, with a clear scope suitable for qualitative research
Defines a problem, but scope could be better aligned with qualitative research
The problem is defined but lacks clarity or relevance to qualitative research
The problem is not clearly defined or unsuitable for qualitative research
Provides a compelling justification for the chosen qualitative technique, with evidence or literature support
Provides a clear justification for the chosen technique, with some evidence support
Justification for the technique is provided but lacks depth or evidence
Provides weak justification for the chosen technique with little to no evidence support
Does not provide a justification for the chosen technique
Offers detailed, hypothetical examples of findings with rich quotes, figures, and charts demonstrating depth and insight
Provides clear examples of findings with relevant quotes, figures, and charts
Provides some examples of findings, but they lack depth or relevance
Examples provided are minimal and do not effectively demonstrate potential findings
No examples or irrelevant examples provided
Plan is exceptionally detailed with feasible execution dates, locations, and a comprehensive compensation plan. Includes an effective pretesting strategy
Plan is well-developed with clear logistics, reasonable dates, locations, and a clear compensation plan. Pretesting is planned
Logistics are outlined but lack detail in certain areas such as dates, locations, compensation, or pretesting
Logistics such as dates, locations, or compensation are vague or poorly planned. Pretesting is not adequately considered
Logistics are missing or completely unrealistic. No consideration for pretesting
Appendix includes a professional, well-designed screener, thoroughly prepared and relevant
Appendix includes a screener that is clear and functional but may lack some detail
Appendix includes a screener; however, it is basic and could be more detailed
Appendix screener is present but poorly designed or not fully functional
Appendix is missing a screener or provided screener is unusable
Appendix includes a comprehensive discussion guide with additional materials, all of which are highly relevant and professional
Adequately defines a problem, with a clear scope suitable for qualitative research
Defines a problem, but scope could be better aligned with qualitative research
Appendix includes discussion guides or materials but they are poorly prepared and lack relevance
Appendix is missing discussion guides or materials or what is provided is irrelevant or unusable
Justifies the sampling method with a robust argument, aligning perfectly with research needs and practicality
Sample is well-justified with a good explanation connecting it to research needs and practical concerns
Sample justification is satisfactory; however, the connection to research practicality needs strengthening
Sample is somewhat justified but the explanation is weak and lacks practical relevance
No justification provided for the sample or it is inappropriate for the research
Recruitment methods are diverse, well-justified, and perfectly suited to the research problem. Ethical considerations are addressed
Recruitment methods are appropriate with a good justification and consideration for ethics
Recruitment methods are adequate, but the strategy or ethical considerations could be enhanced
Recruitment methods are poorly chosen with limited justification and minimal ethical consideration
Recruitment methods are inappropriate with no justification or ethical consideration
The research plan is outstanding in quality, with feasibility clearly established through a thoughtful, well-structured approach
The research plan is of good quality and generally feasible, with minor areas for improvement
The research plan is acceptable, with some issues in quality or feasibility that need addressing
The research plan has significant issues in quality or feasibility, requiring considerable revision
The research plan is of poor quality and not feasible, requiring complete restructuring

name: Group Research - Survey Research Plan

ratings.long_description: Clearly and specifically defines a problem, showing deep understanding of how it can be addressed by a survey
Defines a problem with good understanding and scope for a survey approach
Defines a problem suitable for a survey but with less precision in understanding or scope
The problem definition is vague and only partially suited for survey research
The problem is poorly defined and unsuitable for a survey approach
Provides strong rationale for the suitability of surveys
Gives a clear explanation for choosing surveys
Offers an adequate explanation for surveys
Explanation for survey choice is provided but lacks depth
Fails to explain why surveys are chosen
Presents detailed, well-thought-out sample outputs with detailed charts and statistical analyses to illustrate potential findings
Provides clear sample outputs with relevant charts and basic statistical analyses
Sample outputs are provided but lack detail in charts and analyses
Sample outputs are minimal, lacking in clarity or relevance to illustrate potential findings
No sample outputs provided or what is given is incorrect or irrelevant
Plan includes comprehensive logistics with specific dates, chosen platform, detailed sample population, and compensation plan with a pretest strategy
Plan outlines clear logistics with dates, platform choice, and sample population with a basic compensation and pretest plan
Logistics are present but lack detail in dates, platform choice, or compensation; pretesting plan is underdeveloped
Logistics are vague with insufficient details on critical elements and a weak pretesting plan
Logistics are missing, unrealistic, or have no pretesting plan
Provides full access to research documents including a comprehensive Qualtrics survey and other materials with professional preparation
Provides access to all necessary research documents with good preparation, though some may lack detail
Provides some research documents but they may be incomplete or lack professional preparation
Appendix includes research documents but they are poorly prepared or lack relevance
Appendix is missing critical research documents or what is provided is irrelevant or unusable

name: Group Research - Final Project

rubric.long_description: Problem definitions should be clear, address an important problem, and lead to actionable insights.

The study should be properly designed. It should answer the question(s) in the problem definition. Execution should be strong (given appropriate class-related constraints). Analyses appropriate and reporting insightful. The main text and appendix should have enough details so readers understand the details of the research project.

The study should be properly designed. It should answer the question(s) in the problem definition. Execution should be strong (given appropriate class-related constraints). Analyses appropriate and reporting insightful. Statistics should be listed in the main text or appendix as appropriate. The main text and appendix should have enough details so readers understand the details of the research project.
Recommendations should primarily flow from the evidence given in the research topics. Limitations of methods or findings should be discussed.
Enough details should be provided in the appendix so readers understand research methods and analyses.

The research report should include a clear narrative with conclusions backed by insightful research and analytics. Reporting (e.g., graphs, charts, statistics, quotes, illustrations) should be easy to understand with a focus on the main topics.
